channel.title: Nico Hagenburger
channel.description: I’m Nico Hagenburger. I’m doing websites with Ruby on Rails, HTML5, Haml and Sass.

item.title: Generate CSS Sprites on the Fly with Lemonade
item.description: Generate CSS sprites on the fly with this Sass/Compass plugin: `background: sprite-image("icons/go.png")`—an you’re done.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: HTML5 Placeholder Input Fields Fixed with jQuery
item.description: Enhance your textarea or input fields with the HTML5 attribute “placeholder” and make it work in all Browsers with jQuery.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: How to auto deploy Rails apps after Git push
item.description: Ever wondered how Heroku “deploying” Rails apps via Git works? It’s very easy to setup Git.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: How to use GMail with WordPress
item.description: With Cimy Swift it’s easy to switch from PHP’s mail() to your GMail address
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Designing Twitter profiles (German)
item.description: Best practices to design your Twitter profile
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: 4 Useful HTML5 Browser Support Overviews
item.description: Great tables about HTML5 support in browsers, attributes and elements
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Twittwoch: Tweetup & Logo
item.description: The logo and CI I created for Germany’s corporate tweet-up which I founded with Stefan.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: CSS Snipplets for TextMate
item.description: Little helpers to make CSS editing much more easy in TextMate
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: How to Get to Baku? (And How to Get Back?)
item.description: I had an awesome trip to Azerbaijan and a lot of fun with Aeroflot.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: New Facebook Logo Announced
item.description: After Facebook switched to a Twitter styled layout, they had to update their logo.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: HTML5/XHTML5 with CSS for Safari, Firefox, Opera & IE
item.description: Create cross-browser HTML5 documents. Down to IE6 and Firefox 2.0
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Rails I18n: translation on the fly with TextMate (plug-in)
item.description: Easily insert translations for Rails I18n projects on the fly: just type “t” and hit tab.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Social-Media-Camp vs. bracamp
item.description: Logo drafts for the “Social-Media-Camp” and the “bracamp”
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Lösung: Unterschiedliches Favicon bei mehreren WordPress-Blogs in einem Verzeichnis
item.description: If you’re running more than one WordPress blog in the same directory, here’s how you setup different favicons.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Das Widget – neue Glossr-Definition
item.description: Glossr is a platform to define terms of the Web 2.0 on barcamps.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Mein neues Blog: Das Stadtbahn-Blog
item.description: I started a private blog about Berlin and its public transport systems
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Impressums-Leitfaden vom Bundesministerium der Justiz
item.description: Tipps to design an imprint for German websites by the minister of justice
item.author: Nico Hagenburger

item.title: Barcamps und Spam?
item.description: I’m sad. Barcamp Riga sent spam to me.
item.author: Nico Hagenburger
